abstract: Equal Justice Initiative, organization founded and run by Bryan Stevenson in Montgomery, Ala, releases report detailing history of lynchings in the United States; Stevenson believes victims of lynchings, which his organization puts at 3,959 people from 1877 to 1950, should be remembered by designating sites with markers and memorials, serving to confront country's racial history head-on.
lead_paragraph: After compiling an inventory of 3,959 lynching victims in 12 Southern states from 1877 to 1950, the Equal Justice Initiative wants to erect markers and memorials on certain sites.

headline.main: History of Lynchings in the South Documents Nearly 4,000 Names
